Articles.Content: When I started my first 1.2 save. I loaded up Kerbal X to send the original 3 to the Mun. However, I landed a bit too hard and lost my engine, stranding our beloved Jeb and co. I then send a ssto that I downloaded (Thanks, Matt Lowne!) To save them. The ssto lands ok, but no where near the Kerbal X. No worries. The ssto came with a rover. I could drive to the crash site! Or so I think. I roll the rover, breaking the solar panel. With the mission considered a failure, I pack up to leave. However. As I lift the nose into the air, I lose a NERV. I set the crippled SSTO down and groan in frustration. So I download KIS and set up a repair ship carrying an extra NERV, to be attached to the SSTO. Upon landing the resupply, Surprise! The command pod pops off. After some KIS config editing. I have Dangas kerman, aka. Arnold Kermanagger carry the nerv in his inventory and attach the engine. I then load the resupply crew into the SSTO and we leave. I send a rescue vessel, equipped with Mechjeb, to the still disabled lander. For once. I land with no problems. I load Jeb an co into the vessel. And our orange suited friends are home after 3 weeks kerbal time.

Sounds about right  

I've always found the rescue mission created due to my own personal failures to be the most fullfilling part of Ksp.

Well done!
